intro: Codonoboea ericiflora, commonly known as the woolly ericaceous flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
